com.redhat.rhn.frontend.security

Interface AuthenticationService

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    BaseAuthenticationService, PxtAuthenticationService

    public interface AuthenticationService
    An AuthenticationService is a service that encapsulates authentication logic in coarse- grained operations. Note that this service does not handle logins.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void invalidate(HttpServletRequest request, HttpServletResponse response)
      Invalidates login credentials associated with the given request.

      Redirects the request to a different page Used in restricted period after grace period has expired to prevent basic satellite functionality

    • Method Detail

      • validate

        boolean validate(HttpServletRequest request,
               HttpServletResponse response)
                 throws ServletException
        Validate whatever credentials are associated with the request. For hosted, this will be the sso cookie, and for satellite, this will be the pxt cookie. If validation fails, implementors should throw an AuthenticationException. Note that if an implementation does not support/implement this operation, an AuthenticationException should be thrown, and not an UnsupportedOperationException.
        Parameters:
        request - The current request
        response - The current response
        Returns:
        True is validation succeeds, false otherwise.
        Throws:
        ServletException - If an unrecoverable error occurs

      • skipCsfr

        boolean skipCsfr(HttpServletRequest request)
        CSFR check might be skipped for particular POST requests f.e. all login pages
        Parameters:
        request - The current request
        Returns:
        True if CSFR check shall be skipped for current request

      • redirectToLogin

        void redirectToLogin(HttpServletRequest request,
                   HttpServletResponse response)
                     throws ServletException
        Redirects the request to whatever resource handles logins. This method is typically invoked after a call to validate(HttpServletRequest, HttpServletResponse) fails. Note that the redirect may be client-side or server-side, and it may be to an external or an internal resource.
        Parameters:
        request - the request
        response - the response
        Throws:
        ServletException - If an unrecoverable error occurs

      • redirectTo

        void redirectTo(HttpServletRequest request,
              HttpServletResponse response,
              java.lang.String path)
                throws ServletException
        Redirects the request to a different page Used in restricted period after grace period has expired to prevent basic satellite functionality
        Parameters:
        request - the request
        response - the response
        path - where to redirect
        Throws:
        ServletException - If an unrecoverable error occurs

      • invalidate

        void invalidate(HttpServletRequest request,
              HttpServletResponse response)
                throws ServletException
        Invalidates login credentials associated with the given request.
        Parameters:
        request - The current request
        response - The current response
        Throws:
        ServletException - If an unrecoverable error occurs
